title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: February 25, 2023
Location: Livonia, Michigan
Individual Involved: Mary Cavanagh, 30
Incident Summary: Rep. Mary Cavanagh was pulled over around 2 a.m. after officers observed her swerving between lanes and driving with two flat tires. During the traffic stop, she admitted to drinking at a political fundraiser and underwent a field sobriety test, which she failed. Officers conducted a breathalyzer test, recording a BAC of .176% on scene and later .2% at the police station. She was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Conducted the traffic stop and initial interaction with Rep. Cavanagh.
Administered the field sobriety test and breathalyzer.
Transported her to the Livonia Police Department for further testing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 25, 2021
Location: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Atlanta, GA
Individual Involved: Scott Russell Granden, 36
Incident Summary: Granden was arrested upon landing after allegedly sexually assaulting a female passenger aboard a Southwest Airlines flight. The victim reported that Granden groped her while she was asleep and later smacked her buttocks when she stood up. Upon arrival at the airport, Atlanta Police officers detained Granden, who was reportedly intoxicated and made racist and homophobic slurs toward officers. He also pulled down his pants and shouted inappropriate remarks.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the aircraft upon landing and interacted with Scott Russell Granden.
Documented Granden’s statements and behavior during his detention and arrest.
Transported Granden following the arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – David Koechner DUI Arrest

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – David Koechner DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: June 4, 2022
Individual Involved: David Koechner (actor, known for Anchorman and The Office)
Incident Summary: Ohio State Troopers pulled over David Koechner after observing alleged "lane violations" while he was driving. Upon contact, officers noted the smell of alcohol and observed glossy eyes. Koechner admitted to consuming "one beer" and refused a breathalyzer test. Officers conducted a field sobriety test before placing him under arrest for Operating a Vehicle Impaired (OVI).
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initiated the traffic stop and interacted with David Koechner.
Conducted the field sobriety test and any additional questioning.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Koechner.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 9, 2024
Location: Rainbow Boulevard near Sunset Road, Las Vegas, Nevada
Individual Involved: Charles Snowden (Las Vegas Raiders player)
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a report of a suspicious vehicle at approximately 11:30 p.m. and found Charles Snowden passed out behind the wheel of a running 2017 Jeep Grand Cherokee. The vehicle was in neutral and nearly rolled off a four-foot retaining wall. Upon interacting with officers, Snowden appeared disoriented, initially stating that he believed he was in Florida. A breathalyzer test later showed a blood alcohol level more than double the legal limit.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initially arrived at the scene and located Charles Snowden in his vehicle.
Interacted with Snowden and conducted any field sobriety or breathalyzer tests.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Snowden.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 04/22/2024
Location: Webster, New York (Phillips Road and Doorley’s residence)
Individual Involved: Sandra Doorley (Monroe County District Attorney)
Incident Summary: On the date of the incident, DA Sandra Doorley was reportedly stopped for speeding—driving 55 mph in a 35 mph zone. Instead of pulling over, she called Webster Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier and proceeded home, refusing to comply with the officer’s order to stop. Bodycam footage shows a tense exchange in which she stated she "didn’t feel like stopping" and refused to exit her garage. The officer informed her that failure to stop is an arrestable offense.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Attempted to pull over Sandra Doorley for the traffic violation.
Responded to her residence and engaged in conversation with her.
Communicated with Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier regarding the situation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun
